description: I have been here several times.  The sushi is delicious and fresh. Beef teriyaki is flavorful. There are cold sake options. Owner also makes sushi and is very friendly! For dessert we had the banana tempura with vanilla ice cream. Yuuuummmmm!!!
author: T-money S.

description:
I got so excited when I saw the menu, only to have my hopes shot down upon arrival and opening the package. The biggest source of sadness was just the teeny size of my hamachi sashimi. 4 small slices and small bed of radish was pretty much it. 

The order of eel sunomomo wasn't much better. I never did find the eel, although the shrimp and cucumber were tasty. This overall was probably my favorite dish, but it likewise did not feel like $6 worth.

The one exception is the gyoza, which I wolfed down half of after the other two dishes because I was still hungry. 8 gyoza at a restaurant for $5 is a solid deal any way you slice it. 

All told I paid almost $25 and was expecting a couple meals out of what felt like a fat order, but in the end I got only slightly more than one. Disappointing to be sure - I'm glad I ordered extra.
author: Chris S.

description: They have a delicious teriyaki chicken bento box! It's my favorite so far and I will never look anywhwre else when I have this craving.
author: Nael M.

description: A bit of overpriced for teriyaki plate, but it's good once in a while. Maybe different sauces would be nice...like peppercorn chicken
author: Brenda M.

description: Food was ordinary, overpriced and nothing special.  They wanted to charge me $3 for brown rice instead of white.  I wont be back.
author: Glenn G.

description: This place has always been great. I've been coming here for 6 years and have always had great experiences. Great service and tasty food. People who complain about their price should go out and dine in other sushi restaurants and then they would realize how reasonably priced this place is. Also, people who bad-mouth their service should behave nicely to the servers in first place. I have witnessed some rude customers
author: Bebe G.

description:
I've been coming here for years and have always had good experiences.  I love their teriyaki short ribs because they, honestly, taste like Korean kalbi.  Maybe because the owner is Korean?  I also love their spicy chicken, which is deep fried popcorn chicken.  Aside from the unagi, California rolls and a few others,  I never really had their sushi. The rolls that I did have were good.  

The location itself seems to be getting shadier and shadier, so if you park your car in the garage, make sure to not leave any valuables visible.  I once saw a lady's car window broken and when she came out, she was screaming how she was gone for just 5 minutes to pick up some food she had ordered over the phone.  So be mindful.
author: Milton W.

description: After eating here once again the place has sushi that's more consistent. And honestly quite delicious. It's cleaned up and gotten a lot better.
author: andrew a.

description: I had the 49er roll, I gotta say I was impressed. It was not too spicy. When I tasted it, it feels like an explosion of happiness in my mouth. Altough, the other rolls were not very memorable. To be honest, I can't even remember what were the names of the other rolls. It is not too expensive, I think it is worth it.
author: Sophie C.

description: This is my go to place. The prices are pretty reasonable and the food is amazing. The service is great, they are fast, and friendly! My favorite item on the menu is easily the bento box with tempura. The batter on the tempura is light with the perfect amount of crispiness. The sushi is great as well!
author: Nigel J.

description: Way over priced for what you get. Mediocre quality and tiny portion sizes... Shame...
author: Jackie C.

description:
I come from OC and when visiting other cities I usually stick to what I know r help what sounds the best around where I'm staying for work. 

I tried this place through a recommendation of a friend and i haven't left since. The more you understand that it's a hole in the wall the more you'll come to enjoy the food, ambiance and people.

I've become such a regular they already have tea waiting for me.

Some of the highlighted menu favorites are:

* Potato Croquettes is a favorite! 
* Teriyaki chicken, brown rice combo 
* Lion King Roll
* Galbi 

Best of all the service is wonderful. Whether it's to-go or for there, everyone is extremely nice and patient. 

And I witness someone having a birthday party there! So who knew!!!

Happy eatings everyone!
author: David D.

description:
Been there a few times with coworkers, they're close by to work so it's awesome, I usually order a bento box... but this time I ordered curry beef over rice. Oh my goodness, it was delicious!

The curry has potatoes, beef, carrots and you can taste the spices. The rice is not hard or too soft, it's just right. 

The staff and the waitress are very friendly and will refill your tea if they see you're empty or low. Sometimes service could be slow if they're really busy. Price is pretty reasonable.
author: Eugenia W.

description: I absolutely LUV this place. I've been coming here since they opened 20 years ago. They have by far the best teriyaki chicken I've ever had. The sushi and sashimi are always fresh and DELICIOUS!
author: Carlo D.

description: Delicious food, terrible customer service. It's always something with the young Asian lady who works behind the cash register on Thursday-Friday evenings. I can usually handle people with asshole personalities, however, this broad comes off with a matter-of-fact attitude for no reason. First time she advised me with an attitude that customers aren't allowed to eat food that they ordered there for takeout at the restaurant because the food containers "do not look appealing in the restaurant." I had a meeting nearby and had 15 minutes to eat before I had to take it to go. The second time I ordered my food to go due to the experience just mentioned and when I asked for a chili hot sauce to go (turned out they only had Siracha hot sauce), I was sarcastically advised that normally it is 25 cents, but that this time I can get it for free. Not sure what kind of trauma the cashier has went through or if it's a cultural thing but she really needs to step up her people skills!
author: Nat G.

description:
We live near here so it's just convenient to go here when we want to grab sushi. Honestly, I'd rather drive an extra 5 min to go to Sushi Bistro on 24th, which is really legit.

If you park in the parking lot and enter through the back way, it's disgusting. Grosses me out every time. 

But the sushi rolls are ok enough for us to go maybe a couple of times a year. The lion king roll though has way too much mayo - I had to scrape it all off. I've had really good lion king rolls before and this was the worst. I forgot what else we ordered but it tasted better (see pics). The fried banana ice cream was pretty good, not the best I've had, but cute presentation and I like that they aren't shady on the ice cream. 

The service is pretty nice and fast. Again, worth the 2-3 trips we make here a year.
author: Lucky N.

description: I have to downgrade my rating. Prices have gone significantly up since the last time I ate here. I paid around $16 for a beef plate. No longer a sustainable place to frequent for lunch.
author: Christine L.

description: I went yesterday after not coming to this place for a couple years. The prices have gone up a lot I paid $13 for mediocre poke salad I expected it to be a lot more filling and the fish to b fresher than what I was served. Had chicken katsu which was OK the chicken tasted really weird so I didn't eat all of it. The tables were really sticky and service wasn't as good as what it was. I will not be returning
author: Sarai M.

description:
Gave this place a shot because I was craving Japanese food after work and this was the closet one to me at the time. I Yelped it and it got decent reviews so I went ahead to try it. 

I got a Bento box combination dinner + a sushi roll. Total was almost $35. 
I know this is SF and sushi is expensive but I could have had a Prime rib dinner with that price. The sushi roll is very small and had minimal meat. 

Not a problem, but the sushi maker is not Japanese so that's just a FYI. 

I won't be back any time soon. 

On one good note, the service was quick and the woman server that took my order was courteous and cute. There is no to-go menu.
author: U L.

description:
WHOEVER ANSWER'S THE PHONE TO TAKE ORDERS IS RUDE !!

She was in such a rush to get me off the phone after ordering one thing i couldnt add to the order. then i stopped her before hanging up to ask her the total amount and gave me the amount and hung up my face.. 

i wouldnt waste my time , things sure have changed over the years.
author: Aeriel T.

description: Long wait for everything. I've had to get my own menu I've waited about 20 minutes no food or tea.  Nada.  Long lines for to go orders take precedence over dining in.   I haven't been here in awhile. Not impressed
author: Sean M.

description:
Fish was greasy and the plate was hastily thrown together.

On top of that, the owner was melting down and raging at the poor cook and yelling when I entered.

When I mentioned it to him, he said "safety first." Lol.
author: Susan B.

description:
Back in the day (14 years ago) this was my favorite place.  Clean, good and consistent.  In the years since we have stopped in but did so less frequently as the food quality has gone down. Today I came forgetting the last time we were here and it was disappointing. First thing I noticed were the tables were sticky. I think the counter looked clean but I like sitting at a table. 
Chicken teriyaki was thin and dry. The ebi (shrimp) tasted a little off, so I did not eat the roll with shrimp in it. It looked oddly pinkish. The CA roll was good.  Portions are generous but doesn't matter much considering the quality. 
Sad, nostalgia does not make it a good meal by itself. The food actually has to be up to par considering the price.
author: Maricela L.

description: We have been going here for almost 10 years. This place is special. The food is good. The people are nice and remember us. The sashimi is my favorite. Good price, but not overpriced. Good fish! My kids love this place. Very good for families, too. Food not too expensive for good food that will stuff your stomach happily! Don't let reviews fool you. Come in! Become a regular... you won't be disappointed.
author: Jinny K.

description: Good place to go for a quick bite. They aren't usually too busy and the food doesn't seem to take too long to prepare. Convenient location in Potrero plaza, so it's easy to go for lunch with coworkers and friends. Short-ish walk from 16th St BART and there's a few MUNI stops nearby too. The staff is friendly and the food is consistently good. I usually opt for a quick rice plate or sometimes a bento box.
author: Bianca C.

description:
Being that this place is so convienant to me, I've been coming here occasionally for a little sushi during my lunch hour.

I remember when this place opened, I wasn't a sushi fan but my ex was. We would comprise my coming here. I'd order the bento boxes and he's order the sashimi and rolls. Now that I'm a sushi lover, I go straight for the good stuff.

*Salmon Sashimi: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/imNRDs0iUHjsxaWOvIGwNg?select=uX0AdJs-nXVZeY-QpPWfBQ
*Misc Spicy Rolls: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/imNRDs0iUHjsxaWOvIGwNg?select=jXThyHXU6DuajlNchHFClA
*Miso Soup: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/imNRDs0iUHjsxaWOvIGwNg?select=5B1MnDwtJxrJhRv2xjUykg
*Spicy Tuna: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/imNRDs0iUHjsxaWOvIGwNg?select=8Il_D3SeB8lr7gTYwojfnA

The sashimi is great. The rolls are pretty good, very interesting combinations but all the sauces (mayo type drizzeled) are a little overdone. I ended up having to wipe some off. 

The service here is good and the food comes out pretty fast, which is a better alternative than the McDonald's and other fatty fast food places around it.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
We love to come here when we want sushi and we're in the city!

The parking is not bad because of the parking structure the restaurant is connected to, and it never takes long to get a table.
Salmon Tsutsumi Roll for the win! In general, the fish is very fresh, and the rolls are awesome. We're also fans of the Agedashi Tofu and Hamachi Kama. It's always so delicious when we eat here and I leave full as heck!
author: Kristina S.

description:
Love there pot stickers!!
It's really good the place is nice and clean great food and nice drinks ... But I really really love there pot stickers... I will stopping bye right after work!!
author: Zorana Lovelyallday B.

description: Best baseball rolls ever. And the short ribs are amazing. Great customer service and very inviting environment
author: Latritaha R.

description: Not that great. Prices are way over the quality of food. It's good but not as good as what they are asking to be paid. Their sushi is small for the price and isn't really placed nicely.
author: Chavariana R.

description: Used to love this place but the cashier is rude, prices are up while portion sizes and customer service is down. So much has changed in S.F.
author: Tynesha B.

description:
2015 Update: My wife and I just returned to the Bay Area after living away for the last three years. Of course, we promptly rushed over to our favorite spot, I Luv Sushi Teriyaki. Not only were the rolls as fabulous as we'd remembered, but even more impressive was, Jin, one of the employees, as she remembered our names! Amazing!!!

- - - 

I Luv Sushi Teriyaki is a hidden gem. Situated on Potrero below the Safeway parking lot, if you're accessing the restaurant through the back door in the parking garage, you know that you're in possession of some awesome inside information. The chefs at Sushi Teriyaki know what they're doing, and though they specialize in non-traditional semi-complex sushi rolls everything still tastes fresh and of high quality. Order a Ryan Roll and ask for some ponzu sauce to go with it. In my experience, there are few dishes in the world that can beat this pairing. Seriously. This is one of my favorite spots, and though I've been away from SF for a few years, whenever I visit, I make sure to stop in. Without a doubt, I would give Sushi Teriyaki 5 stars, but they need to work on their bathroom situation a little bit. Otherwise the place is awesome!
author: Justin M.

description: Not my favorite, I felt like the roll was small and the cucumber salad had a different flavor to it than I have experienced at most places. I probably won't go back there for sushi, they did have a curry dish that smelt amazing.. One thing I did like about this place is the parking is very easy!!
author: Cynthia G.

description:
A real neighborhood gem. I've lived in Potrero Hill for the past 3 years but had no idea that there was such a good & inexpensive sushi place right at the Potrero Center. 

Of course, don't come here expecting really fancy and hip decorations. It's homey more akin to your local pizza parlor, clean and well-kept.

The proprietor (Jay) has owned the restaurant for 19 years! That's amazing. Jay and Victor  (sushi chef) are both very friendly and kind. 

I only ordered sushi at this visit since I was craving it. I had the nigiri Hamachi, Sake, a roll of Japanese squash and spicy Hamachi handroll.  Everything tasted fresh and had that nice mouthfeel. 

I'm definitely going to stop by here more often.
author: Justine L.

description: I have no rating to give this place, from management to staff, except the girl that takes orders on phone she deserves a star...last week we had lunch with coworkers here, to make a long story short, i ask for extra ginger and the manager/owner asian gentleman went straight to the ginger container opened it and dug his fingers in it to grab some for my plate, right off i told him not to put it in my plate, i really dont need him putting his dirty fingers in something im going to eat later. If it were the chef it would be different, but i saw him cleaning tables and touching other items in store than he wants to grab ginger with bare fingers, i think NOT!!! NOT SAFE nor am i ever going back!!! stay FAR AWAY!!!
author: mami m.

description: I enjoy coming here for a quick sushi fix. parking is easy and prices are fine. Sushi isn't bad. Service is quick and nice. I believe i get the Jason Roll that me and my girl share every time we come here.
author: Charlie M.

description: The oyako Don was pretty terrible and the ruby roll was meh. Service was not great... If I stuck to the teriyaki bowls maybe I wouldn't be so dissapointed
author: Malisa S.

description:
Beware.  Their website does not say they close at 3pm.  I arrived at 2:59pm and my friend told me we had order quickly.  As soon as I sat down the waitress asked me for my order.  I asked her to give me one minute and she was not pleased.  

We decided to leave since "Customer Service" was not a priority.   we dropped a "C" note at Osaka in the Castro.
author: Mark S.

description: I'm not sure what I expected from a sushi joint in the basement of a parking garage, but this place didn't blow me away. I had chicken terriyaki and a california roll. The california roll tasted like grocery store sushi, which was ok. The chicken terriyaki was very dry and covered in way too much terriyaki sauce. On the plus side, the food came out fast and it was pretty cheap.
author: Diana G.

description: This is my go to spot for a Bento Box in this area! It's a family owned restaurant with the best customer service. I'm even greeted by my name. Fast, quick and delicious meal whether it's take out or dining in. I will continue to support this business!
author: Alex C.

description:
This place is AITE for what it is.

I use to love coming here and my friends and I use to visit this place when we wanted convenient and affordable Japanese food.

However, my last visit here two days ago made me realize I could find better sushi for the price. It seems like they recently changed their menu and along with that jacked up their prices. EVERYTHING was a lot more expensive than what it use to be and I don't know about you but not sure if I'm down to spend 15 bucks on a mediocre roll. The food is actually okay but it's the price makes it not really worth it.
author: Teese N.

description: The Korean short ribs are great and lots of people must agree with me because every time I come in they are cooking them,  They use good quality fish for the tuna sashimi.  And there is always lots of parking! They have an Asahi Super Lucky Cat there too.
author: Paul M.

description:
I work out of the bay view-hunters point area. There isnt very many fresh clean options to eat out here other than fried foods and junk.  Although i dont get to sit in and relax the service is excellent and the food is awesome. The owner is super friendly and always takes care of me and my co-workers. 
-Repeat customer and will recommend to all.
author: J B.

description:
Came here with a coworker to make a big lunch order. We used to come here at least 2-3x a month with fairly large orders. Pitty to write this review because the food is decent.

Wanted to order four sashimi lunches, 12 pieces each, and asked specifically for just tuna and salmon. We come here often and spend lots of money. They would not accommodate (although they have before.. many times... so are you under new management or ownership?) - instead the girl suggested ordering separately so we can get the pieces we want.

So we left. Screw that. Wasting our time trying to figure out how we can make the order work... 

Had planned to order 2-3 other dishes and four other rolls that day. Needless to say this place lost an easy $200 and a good $5k a year from us - that's not an exaggeration - we love us some sushi. At this point we will not come back. It's SF and there's plenty of fish in the sea.... aka, lot's of sushi places.
author: Joe N.

description:
I had almost forgotten about this restaurant and had not eaten here in over two years, but a recent visit to the Comcast office next door has brought me back twice in a matter of days.  

I decided to try their curry rice dishes.  On the first visit I had the Tofu Curry (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/suoD2N1T4bVUkxHMbfWlAw/l).  I liked it so much that on the second visit I ordered the Chicken Curry (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/R15yBg1k0KIKWxOLa_BGpg/l).  While the curry here doesn't come close to matching the curry at Muracci's I enjoyed the flavor very much.  My only wish is that it would be just a bit spicier.  The tofu in the Tofu Curry is of a medium firmness and is not deep-fried like the tofu curry at Muracci's.  I actually liked the tofu better not fried.  The base curry sauce is cooked with chunks of carrots and potatoes.  The two vegetables are very much melt-in-your-mouth soft.  The sauce features a slightly sweet curry taste with a very nice aroma.  

Unlike the tofu the chicken in the Chicken Curry is actually chicken katsu and is deep-fried.  The menu did not state this.  It's a very thin piece of chicken rolled in panko crumbs and fried to a crispy brown.  I was not expecting the chicken to be served katsu-styled and would have definitely preferred the chicken without the panko crumbs.  Also, I prefer brown rice but I can't have that here either.  The curry dishes are served with a cold mixed salad with miso dressing, a cold bean sprouts and cabbage salad and edamame.  All of the accompaniments are good.

I've ordered a basic roll on each of my visits also.  Occasionally, I order fancy, crazy rolls but I haven't done so in awhile because I'm not a crazy fan of the sweet, silly sauces often found on those "jive-ass" rolls.  My New York Roll (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/n8o52Nq-le1l_RrohbkzsA/l) was very fresh as was the Kanpai Roll (http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/DeEaYExR59g4RKk0CeJbhA/l).  Besides the fresh ingredients I liked that both of the rolls held together well because I'm darn tired of rolls that fall apart as soon as they are touched by my chopsticks.

Expect fast, friendly and courteous service.  This restaurant is about a six block walk from my workplace so I will try to eat here more regularly.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: It's a quick, affordable sushi place. They've got lots of those tasty, fried, mayo-infused rolls that are an easy win. I haven't even tried their sashimi or more traditional rolls, so I can't speak to the quality of the fish.
author: Phil G.

description:
This is my go-to Japanese food spot, been going here for years. Their food is so yummy. 

I usually always go for the chicken teriyaki bento box with tempura, mmmmmm....just a plate full of yumminess!!! The chicken is grilled to perfection (I hate undercooked food) and I usually always ask for just sweet potato tempura (my fav) and they always fulfill my request. All the food is made in the front which I like so I can see what's going on with my food if I want to.

Their rolls are also really good, I recommend the staple california roll and tempura roll, spider roll, and ryan roll are all tasty.

The staff is friendly for the most part, every now and then you'll get a frazzled waitress. The owner is super nice and is usually ringing up the orders. Last thing I love about this place is that it is all my Latino cousins cookin up the food lol. Good times
author: Alejandra I.

description:
Baseball roll - fried california roll with salmon and a crap ton of mayo on top.

Lion king roll - california roll with salmon, baked, and then a crap ton of mayo on top.

Croquettes - mashed potatoes with diced carrots, breaded and fried with brown sauce on top. 

Not that awesome, kinda pricey.  Nice service.
author: Walerz B.

description: I took a client here for lunch.  I had a spicy tuna roll and California roll.  My client ordered the mixed sashimi.  We both enjoyed our meals and experienced pleasant customer service.  I will be back when I visit again.
author: Reggy H.

description:
I wish I could give this restaurant a lower review but they don't have negative stars why do I have such a hostile feeling towards them at the moment but let me tell you although it says they close at 10 they actually stopped caring or answering their phones and shut the kitchen down sometime around 9 I discovered this when I attempted to start calling them to call in an order around 9:15 when they didn't answer the phone I wanted to order it ahead of time because after a very hard day at work I had a vision of the perfect dinner for me and my little one that consisted of shrimp tempura bento box for her ribs and mashed potatoes from Boston Market for me but of course they couldn't get on board cuz when I walked in there 30 minutes before they closed they said the kitchen was closed and there everything was shut down and it was because like every time that I've been here the place is empty because of this type of service that they provide I've never heard of a place that couldn't make something as simple and quick as tempura refusing to do so when it doesn't look like they've had any customers all night Long Island did they refuse to make us any food they did so looking at my daughter who was hungry and they look like we were bothering them by stepping on their floor maybe it's just because you're black if they felt like this or they just feel like they're better than everyone else either way it's not a good way to run a business in my opinion
( I'm sorry if this is grammatically horrendous or spelled atrociously I hope that you can get the gist of it but I'm too irritated and angry to go back and proofread anything or out
author: Shannon E.

description:
This is a place I occasionally come for the bento box with teriyaki wings and tempura.  The teriyaki wings is not on the printed menu but it's posted on the wall.  It's a little on the sweet side but overall (at least to me) enjoyable.  They give a pretty nice side salad to come along with it.

I haven't tried their sushi, but I have at Nama located on King Street a short walk west of AT&T Park.  This restaurant is apparently related to that one and I do like the sashimi combo at Nama's, soemthing I go for occasionally before a Giants game during the baseball season.  Therefore, if the sashimi como here is like the one there then for me it would be a positive thing.

Nice staff here, especially the waitstaff ladies (and one in particular) that was here last Thursday when I came for lunch. Therefore, an extra half-star and a roundup to the next whole star rating for the service.
author: H K.

description: Love this place it's right on my way home. Totally deelish and fast service and so many different option. My FAV viper rolls
author: Bonnie C.

description:
Why is it I always expect this place to be bad but end up thinking, "Hey, this is a pretty good place"?

It's probably that awful name...maybe on the signage, they should just replace "Luv" with a big thumping heart because the name keeps reminding me of how popular cheerleaders signed my high school yearbook...y'know, patronizing lines like "STAY SWEET" or "2 GOOD 2 B TRUE!"

Regardless, I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here. I often order the Salmon Teriyaki Box for $8.50, a really good deal that comes with rice, grilled broccoli florets or edamame, salad with miso dressing and clear noodles. If I've been a really good person, I may get one of their special rolls like the $8.95 Rainbow Roll. I love going through the photo flipbook of their special rolls, creative concoctions that look like dragons, caterpillars and other lower life forms. It just seems like the inevitable next step is a porno version that looks like...oh jeez, is it just glad to see me?

It's always busy but never that crowded. Not that much on atmosphere since it is part of the Potrero Shopping Center next to the Boston Market. But the upside is that parking is a cinch since you can just go for the underground parking and enter the place through the back.

FOOD - 4 stars...very good teriyaki boxes...pretty decent maki rolls, some should win "best in show"
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...kinda that "mall" feeling, y'know?
SERVICE - 4 stars...2 Fast 2 Furious with a Tokyo Drift
TOTAL - 4 stars...an unexpected gem but change that name!
author: Ed U.

description:
Good spot for sushi! They have an expansive menu for rolls. I ordered the Dragon roll, 2 California rolls and a Salmon Tteriyaki box. The California rolls were tasty, not the best I've had but good. My friends Mom, who is almost 90, tore up the entire Dragon roll to my surprise!!!! She loved it...I didn't tell her what Unagi was (why ruin a good thing right)...lol. Now the Salmon Teriyaki had no teriyaki! So...it was really bland as was the salad they put in this box. 

Overall, the atmosphere inside the restaurant was very nice. I'd come back again and try some more of their rolls. They had great customer service and they prepared my meal within 15 minutes. :-)
author: Anisha W.

description: Every single thing we got tonight was absolutely delicious.  The Service Was Exceptional.  I highly recommend!
author: Love M.

description: Service was quick, and the beef teriyaki I had was seasoned perfectly. The only trouble with my meal was that the beef was chopped into tiny pieces with lots of gristle, which made it look as though these may be leftover pieces of meat from preparations of dishes using larger pieces of meat.
author: DV P.

description:
Yes, I am a fan.

We go here almost every other Saturdays but we only come here for their bento boxes! 

l luv their Spicy Chicken ($9.50) so much! I'm not sure where does my unusual need to go here...maybe it's their well organized bento box display, or the ever-changing amount of chicken they serve per bento box, or maybe I'm just crazy...

While eating, we often talk about how to steal their Spicy Chicken sauce recipe...So yeah, it's that good!

Also, the waitresses here are really nice. Since we go there so much, they have memorized our "usual" order and what sodas we like.

I can't wait to go back here on Saturdays!
author: Alice L.

description: Love this place there food is amazing. Always fresh and always so flavorful. My favorite is there classic teriyaki chicken and tempura.
author: Alexandra B.

description: Jay and his Staff are always so welcoming and friendly! My boyfriend Eric and I are regulars and don't go to any Sushi spot but here.. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!
author: Jesse M.

description: Good food and good service. One of our go to places in the area. Usually pretty quiet in there. I always get the combinations with the tempura and a roll or two. I have Never been dissapointed here.
author: Nat V.

description: Excellent customer service and great food!!! I went in on my lunch break with 3 co workers. We all got our food fast and it was great! Definitely would go again.
author: Lorenzo K.

description:
Welp, this place use to be my favorite place, don't know if it's under new management or not, here's the story.
Called in my order.
Placed ORDER . FOOTBALL ROLL and Base ball roll. 
Everything was established. Order will be ready in 15mins he says.drove all the way from colma. Get there.Tell the teller that I'm here for a pick up, gave them my name and charged me.They bag my food , thinking it was my food in there.tipped them and leave.Get back home and find out its two orders of chicken teriyaki. Now I'm not nearly as upset up until when I called them back and and spoke to the same guy who took my order.seemed like he knew already because this how it it went
Me:Hello I just came your restaurant and picked up my order, you guys gave me the wrong 1.
Restaurant manager:yeah ...we have your order right here.you should remind us what you ordered
Me:I clearly said I wanted the sushi..rolls.
Restaurant manager:yeah you should've reminded us when you got here.we have many order..we didn't charge you for the sushi rolls..we just charged you for the chicken Teriyaki meals..you can have that for lunch or you can come and return it and pay the difference. 
Me:isn't it the same price anyways?
Him:nooo nono (laughter in his voice) it's much more
(Paid about 21.50 for the teriyaki meals)you should've reminded us when you got here.
Me:so you're saying it's my fault.even though I was very clear on what I wanted to order.
Him:( BLAHHH BLAHHH BLAHHH EXCUSES EXCUSES)
jesus Christ man, take some responsibility on your mistakes. He could've said keep the meals you have now and come pick up the sushi rolls on them.
 
I hate the fact that one person ruined my favorite sushi place. Now I need to find a new one.
Ps.if you guys buy something to go.please check RE CHECK YOUR ORDERS.
author: Salpacino B.

description: I don't really like salmon, but I definitely recommend their Lion King roll. Their veggie Ashley roll is good too. Not really impressed with their bento boxes because I feel like they're skimpy. Their chicken teriyaki however, never fails me.
author: Fallon P.

description: Been here a few times mainly late evening but today I thought I'd try it out for lunch....wrong idea. Service at noon is no bueno . .. gals are pleasant but not attentive. We waited a while to order. I'd still come back for dinner. Maybe not for lunch.
author: Virginia V.

description:
Don't go for Sushi...stay away.....no sushi no....

But for the cooked stuff, like chicken teriyaki and tempura...green light =)
author: Janet L.

description: The sign at the rear entrance says they are open for dinner from 4:30 to 10:00.  I arrived at 9:25 on a Saturday evening, and was told I was too late, they were already closed.  Not good.
author: Lawrence S.

description: The food was cool, service not so cool!! The owner may have been tired. But heck it was my first time. Probably won't come back.
author: Tylon S.

description: They wouldn't let me look at the menu at 2:55pm because they said they were closed. Their hours show they close at 3pm. Can't give a good rating if I can't try the food...
author: Jonathan C.

description: This place is good and the staff has always been friendly. It has however jacked it's prices up. And it is weird that they close in the middle of the afternoon. Will I keep coming back? Yeah - only sushi/good teriyaki place with plenty of parking close by
author: Main M.

description: I've been coming for years! Over 8 years and a review is due. I've always been satisfied b with their sushi options, and bento box options. I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area, and looking to satisfy that sushi/bento box craving!
author: Coraline J.

description:
My family love this restaurant and it's been our go to family dinner spot for over 10 years. 

We love their bento boxes, especially the hamachi gama, spicy pork, short ribs, and chicken options. Sometimes the meat is a bit too salty but usually does not disappoint. The bento specials on the board comes with california rolls or tempura which is more worth it than ordering it on the side. Their salad dressing is so good that I bought a bottle (if you ask, they will specially pack and sell).

Fish is always fresh and they have a ton of sushi roll options. Some favorites are the lion king roll, jd roll, tammie roll, rock and roll, caterpillar roll and more!! 

For large groups, call ahead and they will put together tables for you. No cake cutting fee for birthday cakes and sometimes you get free ice cream =P

Service is always friendly and fairly efficient depending how busy they are that day. 

Parking is easy since it's located at the bottom of the Potrero Center. You can enter restaurant from front or the back through the parking garage.
author: A. Z.

description:
I would go to this place only out of convenience.  The food is average to sub par.  Service is fast so if you are in a time crunch, this place is perfect.  You just expect mediocrity out of this place once you step foot into the doors.  You know it's not going to be good and you are here just because there aren't that many better options.

I actually don't even want to describe this place anymore because it is simply not that good.
author: jason g.

description: I've noticed this place doesn't get the love it deserves. The chicken teriyaki is hands down, the best teriyaki chicken I've ever had. The rice they use on the nigiri is so sweet and flavorful. Jay is great. The kitchen staff is great. Overall, I luv teriyaki & sushi.
author: Ryan N.

description:
My friends and I ventured into I Luv Teriyaki & Sushi because we were in the neighborhood for an art exhibition. 
In the mood for some Japanese food for dinner, we looked up sushi restaurants in the Mission and saw that this restaurant was near the exhibition and had good ratings.

Thank you yelp-ers for the advice!

We got there at around 8:00 pm and the restaurant was only half full. There was only one woman working and she was really sweet and friendly. The parties that were there before us were quite large and she handled everyone's order so efficiently and patiently.

I ordered the chicken udon and Lion King. My friend had some of the udon and immediately said she could taste that it was chicken just from the first sip of broth. I enjoyed it, too. The Lion King roll was quite impressive. It was a California Roll with baked salmon on top of it with "special" sauce-- which happened to be mayonnaise (which I am not a big fan of). Oh well, my mistake. It was delicious none-the-less and ate both of my udon and roll. 

My other friend ordered the Salmon Teriyaki bento and a Nama roll which I couldn't figure out what was in it, but she said it was delicious! 

There are pictures of a lot of their rolls on the menu so you can actually visualize what you may want to eat (which quite possibly could be everything!)

The prices were actually quite reasonable as well. My udon went for $7.95 and the Lion King $8.95. I was mostly impressed by how much of a roll you get for what you pay! 

I just wish I Luv Teriyaki & Sushi wasn't so far! 
But whenever I'm in the Mission, I will definitely pay it a visit!
author: Angela A.

description:
Came here for dinner last night after getting froyo at Nubi. The special rolls menu is one of the most extensive I have ever seen on a menu. My friend and I walked in and was seated immediately. I was happy to see that we were not the only customers as 5 or so other parties were also patrons.

Following the advice of other Yelpers, match the sushi photos with the menu to get a much better idea of what your rolls will look like. My friend and I took at least 10-15 minutes to decide on what to order. The server came by the table at least three times before taking the order. The good appetizers are so expensive! Agedashi tofu for $6 is more expensive than some rolls! The potato croquettes cost $4.50 and only include two, which is insanely wrong. I got the vegetable curry entree (includes rice, salad) $7.50 and the J.D. roll. My friend got the lion king roll and the caterpillar roll.

The food took a while to be served so I suggest getting an appetizer if you are hungry. The sushi arrived first. The caterpillar was a really skinny roll and my friend said that the avocado didn't taste very fresh. The lion king roll was pretty good but i have had better. My J.D. roll was absolutely amazing, highly recommend. My veggie curry arrived last and when I saw it, I was disappointed as it wasn't truly real Japanese curry. I'm very sure it is a package from the supermarket with powder mix. The veggies were only carrot bites and potatoes. I should have just got another roll instead of the curry. I had probably 5 cups of the tea, tasted really good.
author: Dominic T.

description:
I was here last week and was debating if I should write a review or not.  I was just not satisfy with their quality of food. I was there with my husband on a Thursday evening, almost 7pm.  I was debating on the regular bento which was $15.95 but I saw that for $4 more I get vegetables and the option of CA roll. 

We both got their dinner/bento special with tempera for $19.95,  He had the spicy chicken and sashimi and I had the salmon teriyaki and california roll.  Hubby's spicky chicken was just basically chicken karrage with many scoops of chilli sauce pour over it.  My salmon was small and over cooked.  Talking about the vegetable that comes with it, it's only bean sprouts and a few shredded carrots and cabbage.  There was barely any on my plate and I don't know why they have to flaten the rice for you on the plate.  Why can't you just put it in a bowl and flip it over in the box like most japanese?  The most I would have pay for that dinner was $10 for that box.  Worst Japanese dinner I've ever had.  The bill came up to be like $45 so with tip that is like $50
author: AB H.

description: while i have been coming to this place for the majority of my life (i am an SF native), tonight (after not coming for a while), we found a hair 8& the first piece of our lion king roll that was defended to be a piece of "seaweed". it was a small black hair that in no way appeared to be so. when my boyfriend went to talk to an employee, another employee took an unpleasant tone and begun to treat him as if he had little knowledge. soon after he walked away, the youngest waitress begun to talk to the chef in another language while looking at us practically the entire time. while our server was nice enough, she still participated in conversing with the younger server for a lengthy amount of time before & after we paid (tipped according to overall service& ambiance). the tension was extremely uncomfortable and this is no way to treat paying customers. i am extremely disappointed and dissatisfied with the direction this restaurant is headed in.
author: Arianne N.

description: They have a decent selection of rolls but not the greatest tuna by far. I was cheated out of a shrimp tempura today, my plate shoulda had 3 but only gave me 2.
author: Drew M.

description:
Great sushi but kinda expensive.  My Giant and I can easily spend $50 for lunch there.  

I always get the spicy scallop sushimi and the crazy cucumber roll (both great for a low-carb diet!),  Scallops are delicious and the cucumber roll is freshly peeled. Never can finish it, but good to bring home for dinner later that night.

49'er roll is awesome too!

Soft drinks are served in a can there, but convenient for this diet coke freak.

Never had a problem with service until the last time I went.  They messed up on my order completely and the blame game was going on amongst the staff.  Guess what?  I CAN HEAR YOU!  I didn't care the order came out wrong, but I guess everyone else did.  I even heard the waitress say, "She didn't say that", as if I don't get the same thing ever time and not know what to order.  It would not prevent me from not going back or anything, but next time I hope the tiffs can be a little less vocal and the staff a lil' more professional.

Very conveniently located, and parking is a breeze at Potrero Hill.
author: Stacey D.

description:
Closes at 3pm and reopens for dinner.

Venue - Located conveniently in the Potrero Center with free garage parking with plenty of parking spaces.

Main Entree - Spicy chicken teriyaki with kim chi was the best I've had in California. The chicken was grilled to perfection and was not dry. 

Service - Very friendly staff and quick. 

Nice benefits - Also has sushi and a huge selection of bento box combinations.
author: Huy D.

description:
I luv teryaki and sushi!!!? Generic name...I used to work at an "I LOVE SUSHI" in Santa Cruz, but the rolls here are delicious!!! 
Things to order:
*The LION KING roll (my absolute, all-time favorite)
*The Giants Roll
*The World Series Roll
*The House Special Roll

The barbecue ribs here are really delicious. That marinade sauce MMM!!!!!! They make it themselves and it's so freakkkkkking good. Apparently, Tim Lincecum comes here on occasion to get take-out chicken teriyaki. HE WOULD order chicken teriyaki...lol! Food for a world series champ for ya! The owners love me here and they even named  a roll after me (The Denise Roll) on the special menu! Haha! I'm embarrassed to say that I haven't tried it yet, but it's on my to-do list. I just can't stop ordering that lion king roll......

I also love the fact that this place is located in a shopping complex because there's always parking right in front! awesome
author: Denise L.

description: Average sushi and bento boxes, I've had better chicken teriyaki at the local mall. Service is fast and friendly
author: Mimi W.

description:
Disregard the generic name of the restaurant. I have driven by this place many times and never ventured in (despite my love for sushi) because of the weird name. That was until a friend told me that this place was pretty good. 

I've eaten here several times and the rolls/sashimi are pretty good. They have like a million rolls and their pictures on their little flip menu, so it takes forever to decide what to order. The sashimi that I've eaten is fresh and not fishy.

The service is pretty slow. They are not staffed for how busy it gets during lunch and consequently, ordering and getting your food may take a long time. I ordered take-out one time in advance and had to wait like 20 minutes before my order was ready. Minus point for that and their lack of staff.
author: Regina W.

description:
Saturday Night Sushi Fever! I was craving and wanted something that i could trust. So i take a short drive to grab my Japanese comfort food.

The deluxe combo and a 49er roll still eases the pain...food issues? maybe. Still a "Big Mike" staple.

4 stars.
author: Michael G.

description: As a sushi lover I must say that I was disappointed. Ordered a salmon and unagi nigiri as a starter, it was less than impressive. My boyfriend ordered the hamachi kama with tempura and I ordered the Korean chirashi bowl. The kama was overcooked and not fresh, she brought orders in separately without informing us and the chirashi bowl was awful, very little fish, used imitation masago, and no sesame leaf. The waitress didn't check on us once, except to pick up the bill. I am never returning. Lunch ended up to be $50, that can buy a wonderful experience at blowfish sushi. Be warned, this place is no good!
author: Sara B.

description:
Name says it all, I love their teriyaki and sushi.  I can say that trying this place was mainly for teriyaki, I'm a bit of a skeptic in trying sushi at new places because of the freshness.  After returning a few times, we actually tried the sushi and so the story goes.  We've been returning to this place since 1999.  Actually became friends with the owner.  

If you like this place, try out any of the Nama Sushi restaurants - King Street in SF, Walnut Creek, Oakland and Daly City, all the same owner!
author: M D.

description: Bento box with a combo of Teriyaki beef & Chicken was in generous portion with rice. Good aroma and charred broiled taste of both items was satisfactory.  I didn't like the very small sides with the bento. There were only 2 bite of lettuce salad and the same of the  bean sprout side, I also added a California roll which was standard. A OK place to go if you want a bit  of change in the area in Soma.
author: Wolfy W.

description:
I'm not understanding some of the higher-starred reviews, so I may give the place another try for their sushi...

Have had bento boxes, udon, and their appetizer noodle here.  The silvery appetizer noodle was pretty inedible.  The sauce was tasteless, and I ended up bringing it home for my husband to "rescue" with his spices.  The bento boxes were a-okay, but I would have preferred that the udon be taken off the menu until they increase the quality.  The mushrooms in the udon tasted rehydrated to me (the really rubbery texture was not pleasant -- reminded me of the Wolfgang Puck sushi bar's dehydrated mushrooms in their miso soup) and the broth left an msg-like burning sensation on my tongue and lacked umami.  For over $10 after tax (no tip yet), the udon was comparably-priced to the great-tasting nutritious stuff in Japantown.

Service was very friendly and responsive, though, and they do seem to have a decent lunch crowd.  Its convenient location in the mall complex is good for folks too hungry to venture further, and the garage provides free parking.  You can enter the restaurant through its back -- one floor down from the garage deck.
author: Christine T.

description:
This is probably my favorite place to eat in san fran. They have great presentation and best of all...a large giant photo menu! I love seeing all the pretty sushi colors! They have some really good maki recipes. Try the Lion King roll. Its a baked salmon roll that has amazing sauce. Their sesame chicken is also fantastic!

Its a super casual environment and right next to Safeway so its easy to stop by before shopping. The service is VERY fast so its perfect for a quick bite.

Not much of a sake menu so I usually settle for an Asahi.
author: Devin S.

description:
yum i LUV this place. they have one of the biggest selection of special rolls that i have ever seen. just reading the menu line by line my eyes would start watering.

here's what i usually do when i go there: start off with the agedashi tofu for something light and then annihilate the rest of my calorie reserves for the day with the viper and lion king roll. then sit back and groan about how full and happy my stomach is.

however there is a downside. it's pricey and that's actually why there's one star knocked off. as much i want to eat here everyday, my wallet cannot eat here everyday as two rolls will easily cost over $20. they do encourage you to pay in cash instead of credit card by giving you a small discount but meh, it doesn't make much of a dent in the end.
author: The Hangry Chef O.

description:
The special rolls are on-point here! I've been to their other location in Daly City, Nama, and surprisingly the rolls are cheaper here! I guess they can jack up the prices a bit in DC since Nama is the only decent sushi place in that area. I think they have a better selection of sushi here, too.

This is a favorite lunch spot for sushi amongst my co-workers. I appreciate "picture menu" on the table - it gives a visual of most of their rolls. Today, because of the picture menu, we discovered the stadium roll. We weren't sure exactly what was in it, but it looked delicious! We couldn't even find it on the menu. But the waitress assured us that it was one of their popular ones. 

The four of us shared the spider, rainbow, ryan, and stadium rolls. Turns out, the stadium roll is a shrimp tempura and crab roll topped with tuna, soft shell crab and their special spicy sauce. So good! All the other rolls were yummy as well, especially the ryan - another shrimp and tempura roll topped with salmon and their spicy sauce.

I have yet to try their teriyaki dishes. But every time I open the menu, my eyes go straight for the rolls and I can't resist.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
It's close by my work and the only sushi restaurant around, so there's not much of a choice on where to go when I'm craving japanese. Here's what I'd recommend:
- spicy chicken
- udon
- chicken teriyaki
Those are the few things I generally tend to stick with and they usually don't steer me wrong. I've had a few of their rolls, but it's nothing memorable. Overall, the food is decent, and they have pretty good customer service.
author: Sharon G.

description:
This is one of my favorite sushi spot... staff are friendly, the food is great, portions are perfect and they don't over do it with the rice when making the rolls... everything is so fresh and most of all its very affordable.. I am a definitely a fan.. 

You definitely need to try there
-Lion King Roll
-Dream Gina Roll
-Stadium Roll
-Spicy Lobster Roll
-Short Rib Bento Box Combo( mouthwatering)
-Fresh Oysters.. 

I can keep going on and on but your just gonna have to try it yourself, and definitely you'll be coming back for more!
author: Shirl C.

description: I work in the area and finally decided try out this establishment since I do love teriyaki beef boxes. I recommend going for lunch time which they serve until 3pm because the prices are less, yet the servings are large. The beef was cooked nice and tender in a perfect teriyaki marinating. The rice and salad served with it compliments the the meat and noodles. I was not expecting a sit-down type of establishment but was quite satisfied with everything. I would definitely recommend this location to anyone looking for a nice, and tasty Japanese meal ^.^
author: Diego A.

description: I think this place has changed names (but same owner).  It now goes by Nama.  It is still really good, and now I'm hoping I can get their spicy crab crunch roll in the East Bay.
author: Will A.

description:
This is the first entry in my "Potrero Center" food trilogy--it's a dirty job but somebody's got to Yelp it.  And besides, it's too close to my office to ignore forever.  

First up: I Luv Teriyaki & Sushi, tucked away on the Potrero Ave side.  So am I supposed to order teriyaki or sushi?  Well, when in doubt, don't order sushi.  Besides, strip-mall teriyaki brings back some good high-school memories.  

On a hot day, this place is baking inside, but the staff was friendly enough, and the layout of the place actually has a bit of pep.  Now, I like my teriyaki like a double ice cream cone: a big scoop of meat over an even bigger scoop of rice (with enough sauce to soak well into the rice--but that's really more of a snowcone metaphor) .  So I was disappointed when it arrived in a rather shoddily-arranged bento box, and with a less-than-generous serving of rice.  The meat itself was ok, but nothing spectacular.  Who knows, maybe sushi is their specialty after all?  One thing's for sure: I really need to figure out where the quality teriyaki is in this town.
author: Wes M.

description: Perfectly good strip mall sushi. No, it's not the pristine morsels of gleaming $30 ono sashimi just like you once had in Okinawa. But that's not why you came here, is it?  You didn't come to watch the beautiful people struggling not to drip the house-brewed tamari on the white linen tablecloth. You came to push up your sleeves and enjoy some sloppy, drippy, spicy-good rolls without worrying about tobiko in your teeth or spicy sauce dribbling down your chin.  Save your sashimi jones for Ozumo. Get that stick out of your ass, order a Charlie roll, say "you're welcome, tummy!" and tip your servers and sushi chef generously. They are incredibly nice and attentive.
author: Michele W.

description:
A good place to indulge your craving for sushi without having to rob the World Bank. This goes in my list of Cheap Eats in SF! It's not high end "gourmet" Japanese food but its pretty decent all the same.

I've been here for lunch and dinner during the week and on weekends, and the food has been pretty good, so has the service and of course, the price. 

If you have a car, there is plenty of parking in the underground parking lot. If you don't have a car, take any bus that goes down Portrero and you'll be here in no time. I've never experience a wait.

Carnivore, are we now?
1. Gyoza is pretty darn good at $4.99 for 8 pieces
2. Calamari with spicy sauce is worth trying but can be a wee bit on the greasy side
3. My staple order every time is the Teriyaki that is served in a box with rice, vegetables, salad and clear noodles. For an average price of $8.00, you get a lot. I've left pretty full and satisfied with the food and the price
4. If Teriyaki is the way you want to go, the Spicy Chicken, Pork Teriyaki and Salmon Sashimi Teriyaki are great!

Oh! But you're a Herbivore!
1. No worries! The edamame is very good
2. Chuka (Seaweed) salad is nice with a different texture
3. Veg noodles stir friend with vegetables is wholesome and filling
4. Udon soup rocks!

Don't be fooled by its plain exteriors or simple interiors. The food is good and service fast. The staff are friendly and it seems to attract a mixed crowd. Check out their sake menu as well. Good place to come on your own or with friends or even a group.

All in all, a pretty good place for no nonsense, convenient, dependable and AFFORDABLE sushi. Check them out for sure. Ah so!
author: Amit S.

description: Bang for buck sushi, for sure. Actually, this is a solid easy going, convenient and affordable sushi joint in the City since it gives off a very clean appearance, an important element to any sushi joint. You can easily walk in and get a table and it's a perfect pre-game stop before a night at Mighty which just around the corner. The service is quick, the sushi is affordable and the staff is friendly. I especially liked the lion king roll and I love that they have Sapporo on tap.
author: Chelsea P.

description: I'm never disappointed when I come here. The portions are huge. My only complaint is that service can be slow when they're not busy.
author: Lo L.

description:
Mmmm....A friend of mine has me ADDICTED to this place.
I'm not a huge sushi fan at all so whenever I go to a Japanese place I only order chicken teriyaki.

Their chicken is always so fresh.  Their rices is always so fluffy.  My friend and I love their teriyaki sauce.  They have this great garlic and hot sauce as well.  

If I could change one thing about this place, it would be that I wish they would start serving brown rice.

Ohhh forgot to mention, parking can be kinda sucky and their Tempura is GREAT!!!!
author: Sandra S.

description: Came here a couple of days ago with my boyfriend for some sushi after going to the UPS to drop off some packages. I ordered the Croquette (Deep Fried Mashed potato cake) and a Deep Fried California Roll. My boyfriend ordered a Bento Box. I'm giving this place 3 stars because I believe that they should change their deep fryer's oil because I can actually taste old oil through my deep fried foods; the tea they were serving was quite bland and watered down; and my boyfriend's Bento box was suppose to come with a soup, but he never received one. Other then that the place was clean except the bathrooms. The food was decent, and looked fresh. I do have to give them props on their rice, it was quite perfect, not too hard and not too soft (mushy).
author: Susan K.

description:
After reading the lastest yelp on this place, I was worried that this place gone down the hill so of course, I felt compelled to go and try it again.  All I can say is to whom it said this place was a hole in a wall place, she is soooooo wrong.  Don't get me wrong.  This place is no 5-star restaurant but it is no hole in the wall place either.  It's just a place to go to eat great tasting food for less $.  I ordered their dragon roll and rainbow roll again.  It is consistently fresh and great tasting.  

I'll break this place down for you.  

Atmosphere:  3 stars out of 5.
Food quality/taste:  10 stars if there is such a thing.
Dress:  casual
Noise level:  medium
Price:  $$ out of $$$$$.

Oh BTW, try their chicken teriyaki.  Unlike other restaurant where they precook their chicken and throw it in the microwave before pouring the teriyaki sauce over it, this place actually "grills" their chicken right where you could see it.  Result is tender and great tasting chicken. 

They have many rolls so if you get overwhelmed or don't know what to order, look at their handy dandy rolodex-like index card with pictures of the rolls.  There's no guessing game.  I haven't tried any of the ooouie gooouie looking roll especially the ones with mayo ingredient but if you like mayo, you should try it.  My nieces and nephew swears by it.

Go there early during lunch as it gets crowded and they get very busy but they are very efficient in the way they run.  Hence, it may come across and feeling like you are in a fast food restaurant but I assure you, they are not!
author: Nancy Q.

description:
Have you've used Yelp's Monacle feature on the iPhone app yet?  You point your camera in the direction you're heading and a bunch of restaurants float on the screen. Well, that's how I found I Luv Teriyaki.  That, and partly because I was starving. 

I was craving hamachi kama and lucky for me, it came in a bento box with rice, three types of salads, and edamame.  They place can't be Japanese owned, because they mispelled "kama" as "gama" twice on the menu. What's hamachi gama?  They also ran out of regular rice, so the owner yelled at the waitress to tell us they're out. The waitress came over to tell us the news we had already heard.  They gave us sushi rice instead. The hamachi kama was good, but the sushi rice was overdoused with too much vinegar.  

Nice place for lunch considering there's not much choice in the area.
author: Bruce M.

description: This place is the best. the teriyaki chicken is so YUMMY!!!! it has the best flavor i have had. I have not been able to find a place that tops this one. i dont eat seafood but my husband does and he loves there sushi here...i crave for there tempura you all have to try this place you will not be disappointed . the service is great they are always quick. i promise you can not find better.
author: angelina h.

description: My GF and I came here for lunch today. The place was half full. We were seated promptly. I don't know if the waitress was being over attentive or just rushing us. They must have asked us three times if we were ready to order. Geeus...Give us some time to decide. We shared 12 pieces of assorted sashimi, spicy tuna roll and rock n roll. Everything was fresh. Nothing special. As we were eating ...all of a sudden the waitress came by and gave us the bill. WTH We didn't even ask for the bill. Now I'm feeling rushed. There's sooo many sushi joints in the city to dine at...I won't be back!
author: Jo S.

description:
I don't feel like writing about Sushi.
Because this place is so typical stereo-typed Japanese restaurant in America running by Korean.
Well,
in the way, 
J-town in SF becoming like that too.
Again, I am not against Korean Sushi at all.
I like some of it.
I dislike most of it.
but, this place is just bad as shit.

I went there with my Chinese friend.
That was a mistake.
He knows about Chinese but not sushi yet.
Something wrong about presentation in this place.
Makes me puke.

It is cheap.
So you are eating cheap-shit sushi by cheap-shit sushi maker who has cheap hands.
Why don't we go to safeway to get their sushi insted.

I just can not trust cheap hands.
Hope they wash their hands,
author: Nobu K.

description:
arrival back home to san francisco....mention just had $two hundred maine lobster, dungeness crab, live prawns, fish stew and sashimi platter lunch at redondo beach pier end...back in city and dazed....quick stop at sports basement....linger and shop 'til closing....dinner time and only request being....no seafood~!!@#!!!....driving circles and passing i love teriyaki sign....guess teriyaki doesn't have to be seafood....

since name....teriyaki order....teriyaki chicken for $eight bargain at dinner hours....sides plenty....tasty dressing salad, seasoned "jap-chae" noodles, soybeans snap and vegetable noodle mixing...teriyaki saucing higher sweet...texture light....large average bento meal at bargain pricing....
author: Hen A.

description:
I was completely expecting I Luv Teriyaki to have tepid reviews, because people tend to be very down on inexpensive sushi.  I guess I don't need to defend this restaurant, though, because it definitely has a following.  Now I have to think up a whole new strategy for my review.  So here goes nothing..

I luv the limitless parking, excellent service, great food, and greater prices.  I luv the sneaking suspicion that they serve up bulgogi instead of "beef teriyaki", and I really luv the all-too-unfamiliar feeling of being completely full but still getting change back from a $20 bill.

God damn, I luv this freaking restaurant.
author: Adam W.

description:
I'm very limited to what kind of sushi I can have. Shockingly, although I'm 1/2 Japanese, I'm allergic to fish. Yeah, yeah, yeah. I know. How odd. Moving on. 

It's Saturday and after a failed attempt at dropping off the Comcast equipment next door at the Comcast store, Eugy and I decide to drop in here for lunch. We ordered:

Gyoza - decent gyoza but you can tell it's the frozen kind
Goma ae - The sesame sauce used for this was bleh... 
Tako sunomono - though the tako was good, this was not true sunomono and the cucumbers had not marinated in the sake/vinegar mixture long enough to soak up any flavor. 

and for rolls, I can't really remember the names. They were very inventive with their rolls and even had a picture album on the bar so you could see what it looked like. We had a roll with shrimp tempura, crab, avocado and cucumber. And another roll which was basically a california roll with baked scallops in spicy mayo on top. Both were really good, but the baked scallops one was kinda hard to eat. Due to being baked, the rolls were falling apart. It was still tasty though. 

Service was polite and the place is clean. Wouldn't go out of my way to come back here though.
author: Jen D.

description:
Alright, so my sushi snobbery is starting to come out.
This place is good. I stand by what I said before. It's solid. But it's not melt in your mouth delectable sushi. Just good, middle of the road, reasonably priced sushi.
This is the great, standby, middle of the week sushi place. You know, the place where you go 'cause they know you, are nice to you, and you aren't trying to have a special date. It's good. Always solid. Who woulda thought that strip mall sushi could be so good.
author: Margie L.

description:
Although I haven't been here in several months, I still contend this is one of the best  inexpensive sushi/Japanese restaurants in town.

First off, the price is right.  There are way too many over-priced sushi restaurants in this town.  Even their sister restaurant (NAMA http://www.yelp.com/biz/nama-sushi-san-francisco#hrid:-z3WIKYLVFW7sPlUOb9CkA/query:nama) is more expensive (albeit, it is in a prime location near SBC/AT&T-whatever-the-hell-the-sponsor-is park).  

Another positive is that it's located in the Potrero Center which boasts a plethora of parking.  So even if it's not your hood, it's easily accessible by MUNI or car.  Not only that, you can tag grocery shopping onto your sushi fix as there's a Safeway next door (okay, maybe this is stretching it as a positive, but it works for me).

Oh, and the food - very good.  Nothing over the top spectacular, but fish is fresh, seaweed salad is excellent (always a determining factor for me) and the service is fast.  My only negative is that they serve their edamame cold.  I prefer it warm (with lots of salt) so I don't usually order that when I visit.

Not much atmosphere, but when you consider the speed and the price, it's worth it.  Definitely somewhere you should check out if you're looking for a quick, inexpensive sushi/Japanese restaurant.  If you're looking for atmosphere, head down the street to Blowfish (http://www.yelp.com/biz/blowfish-sushi-to-die-for-san-francisco#hrid:u2VREjG3f0neoPuQgFlLfQ/query:blowfish)...just expect to pay for it. ;-)
author: Melanie N.

description:
I enjoy the Chicken Curry and the Beef Teriyaki. They are a good value - around $8 with sales tax.  Free tea and/or water.  When I would go there with a Korean friend of mine, we ended up getting free Miso soup more often than not.  When I go there just my white self, I get free tea and/or water - no free Miso.  :)

I've not had any sushi here - but they seem to do a good job.  This is one of the few eating spots in the City where I can drive there without worry about finding free parking courtesy the nice, big suburban-like parking garage located there to the benefit of Safeway, 24 Hour Fitness and the other stores in this strip mall.
author: Jamie W.

description:
So you've had a long day of work, have no food in the fridge, don't feel like going to Trader Joe's to pick up groceries.

Furthermore you don't want to make a production of your meal. Just something good to eat while you watch the good old TV.

Oh if I could count the number of times I've been in that situation...

Luckily there is I Luv Teriyaki which is perfect for exactly such a night. Go in and order the teriyaki chicken dinner. 7 bucks for a sizable meal that is really good and that is pretty healthy (keep the sauce on the side -- of course like I have to tell you). Plus its ready to go in a few minutes, or why not sit down and take a load off Sally. 

I can't speak to the sushi as I haven't tried it yet.

One thing I've noticed is that there are a lot of regulars that go to this place.  It must be true luv indeed.
author: Ish H.

description:
I went here on a family excursion. We had 6 in our group. 

I heard about this place from all the others that were eating with me, they are regulars.

We sat down by the window and began looking at the menu. Everything looked so good. I finally made my decision on the Hamachi Bento Box (the name of it could be wrong, but it was something like that)

It was HELLA good. =) 

The reason why i give this place 3 stars is because it was kinda dingy and ghetto. There were ghetto kids sitting at the sushi bar. One of them had a huge blanket. I'm not talking about a throw blanket, i mean a queen size blanket. It's called a jacket... Also, the tables were wabbly, and the menus needed a good wiping.
author: J-nine I.

description:
I have this new job in a new and different area and the best getaway from work is a great lunch with a few of my coworkers.   Sooooo today we chose to eat at I Luv Teriyaki.

Usually when I'm yelping, I don't pay too much attention to the "poor-er" ratings especially if the overall average rating is pretty high...  So I don't know if i set my expectations too high, or it was just not a great day for us to be there.  

Actually, my experience here was terrible.

we got there around peak hour, 12:15pm-ish.  It was crowded, it was HOT, there was no ventalation, and it just didnt seem very clean.  Ok ok, but I was hungry and I wanted food.  A pretty bad stench came from the meny, and multiple plates had this "oil" on it.  No, it wasn't water because it would have dissolved, not remained shiny.

ok ok so whatever, the restaurant isn't clean.  

So, like I said, we got there around 12:15, ordered maybe 5 minutes later, and as time flies by, its 1:10pm and we havn't even gotten our FOOD yet.  We ordered 8 rolls of sushi and not one had came out.  

I really wondered if the waitress had forgotten to put it on our order... or they must be REALLY backed up.  I don't know, but whatever the situation was, it was not OK.  Guests who had just been seated right next to us left when they heard we had been waiting for almost an HOUR for our food.  

 Finally, just about 5 miinutes after questioning the waitress, she came out with four rolls.  After finishing them, it took them another 10 minutes to get the other rolls done?  I don't get it.  Ok.  Sushi chefs are awesome.  They work hard and can make some good stuff.  I have been to places where they pump out your rolls in like 10 minutes-- thats what I call HARDCORE.  These rolls were good, but they weren't GREAT.  I just couldnt believe we waited so long for our food.  

I just don't know.  I don't know if I'm being too hard on them, or if its just some mistake that wasn't supposed to happen, but after coming here once, I'm definitely not coming here again.  period.
author: Michelle N.

description:
I love this place.

The sashimi is always super fresh, they have Sapporo on DRAFT, and the sushi chefs always get my order just right. I'm particular, and order with lots of addendums, but the chefs not only always get it right, they remember my preferences from visit to visit! 

My favorites are the escolar sashimi (some call this super-white tuna... it's a buttery white fish that is DIVINE), the dragon roll, and the zesty roll. 

I'd give them ten stars if I could.
author: SisterMable S.

description: Fast and ok lunch deals.   Their teriyaki boxes are much better than their sushi, esp the spicy pork teriyaki.
author: Dave C.

description:
I started goin to the Iove Terayaki & Sushi in Concord... about 3 years ago yes they are in a little strip mall as well...

 Since I moved there chasing a relationship dream ( CONCORD WHAT THA Fuck) Must have been into that one so anyways I got tired of not eating out.. so I had to search out any edible restaurants  (which is not an easy feat when u move to Bridge and Tunnel Land )I

 Low and behold I love Teryaki and sushi... it's  Concord it's located next to the Brendan Theatre in downtown Concord..
Yes it's in a strip little mall thing Everything in Scary Bridge and Tunnel land is..

But the food was good and I became a regular there I even have a shirt. Back to the original review when I saw the one on Potrero and since they are related (though the food is better in Concord) I started
coming to this one...When my relationship finally feel apart
(Thank God for that...no more bridge and tunnel..no more Denny's)

Anyways great place for a bento box in either location
author: Kim R.

description: I love all their rolls here and their combinations boxes are so worth the price!!!
author: Terinna R.

description:
This is my once every other week lunch spot. I think it's more like a 2.5 kinda place but the service is fast enough and can accomodate those crappy 1/2 hour breaks. Other than their non-deluxe bentos, this place is kinda overpriced, but I do enjoy their Korean style multiple sides, lettuce salad, sprouts/cabbage, and sesame glass noodle. 

My coworkers rave about their spicy teri pork, but I have yet to try it.

I Love Teriyaki for me is more of a place to get the eating lunch chore out of the way, but not really a dining destination.
author: Faffy L.

description:
Seating:  Not good for group over 4.  Go there before noon if you want to be seated.  A tad after 12pm, they are usually full.

Price:  It comes out to around $10-$11 after tip if you get there bento box special.  Could get it for a buck or two cheaper elsewhere, but you'll have to travel further away.

Food:  I am happy with the portion of food and taste.  Compared to other places in the area, they serve more bang for buck.  Orders come pretty quick after you order them.

Environment:  Its nothing classy, just a normal restaurant that serves Japanese food.
author: Henry T.

description:
This was the first sushi place I ever went to.  I was not a big fan of fish at all, but I Luv opened up right next to my job at a time that I was really getting into health and fitness.  I went in there and explained that I had never has sushi before and I was a little tentative about it.

The owner was there and recommended some items for me to try and 10 minutes later I was getting more daring in a second order to go.

That was about 10 years ago and I still go there for a great well priced meal.  The staff is really friendly and always make sure to say hi to the regulars.  When the owner is there he takes time to come by and say hi which is big in my book.

Everyone I have ever taken there has really enjoyed the food and the prices as well.
author: Matthew F.

description:
Hello, my name is Nancy,  and I live in the Excelsior.  We, of the Excelsior, are not hip.  We do not have wide-ranging choices when it comes to take-out or delivery food.  We are not sad.  In the land of Excelsior, parking's not bad and there's a freakin' huge park 1/2 block behind my house.

But.  Still.  I have no 'go to' sushi / Japanese restaurants close by.

I Luv Teriyaki & Sushi = decent teriyaki and sushi that's close enough to drive to on a whim - and park!! - and get back home while it's still good.

I don't 'love', love them, but I really, really like them.
author: Nancy W.

description:
I am not a sushi connoisseur but I can eat $100 dollars worth of sushi in one sitting.  No, I'm really not lying!

When I was young I wasn't allowed to leave the table unless all of my food was finished.  That's beside the point.

I Luv Teriyaki Sushi is a extremely good option for cheap sushi in the city.  The spicy crab crunch roll is excellent for the $3 dollar price and the Kalbi (Short Ribs) is adequate for not being at a Korean BBQ.  

And yes, I am grouping Japanese, Chinese, and Koreans together.  Get over it.  We all come from the same.
author: Justin C.

description:
I stopped here for lunch yesterday (Wed. 10/19) after leaving the Comcast service center in the same building. I was actually in a good mood after yelling at the guy behind the counter at Comcast, but I didn't have a lot of time left to eat so I figured I'd give this place a try. 

I agree with some earlier reviewers that the ambiance of the place is much like what you'd find at a shopping mall food court but at 1:30pm it was packed with the local lunch crowd so I figured it was probably safe to eat there.

I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki & Tempura special - $9.90 and I also decided to try the sparking sake (Ozeki hana-awaka) just because I read a post on Yelp just a few days back going off about how good it was.

Service was good, if just a little slow but again it was pretty packed. I don't fault them for it. The meal itself was plentiful and very tasty. I usually don't have a problem finishing of a lunch but in this case I couldn't finish all the sides, cold noodles, Edamame, and even some of the rice. (where was my miso soup?)

The sake was sweet as I expected it would be but I can't say I'm a big fan of the carbonated sake drinks. I should've just ordered green tea (ordered?). 

So I finish quickly and jump on my motorcycle to get back downtown and when I'm almost there my stomach starts to really ache. I actually had flashes of me puking in my helmet. I'm not sure what that was about but it didn't last long so I doubt it was any problem with the food. Maybe I just ate to fast or got a weird reaction to the sweet alcoholic drink. 

Anyway I would probably eat here again although I'm not usually in that neighborhood but I'm definitely staying away from sweet sake. *pugh*.  Now mixed Soju drinks are a different story but that's for another review.

update - 09/20/07
On my way home today I stopped by Super Tokiko and found the same sparking sake I had at this place (Ozeki hana-awaka). I'm sipping it now as I write this note and I do like the taste. I doubt it was the sake that made my stomach turn after lunch that day. Another plus is at ST the same bottle was only $4.50, Bargain!
author: Johnny H.

description:
First of all, I just wanted to say that this is my first review because I just found out about yelp from the Chronicle article a few weeks ago.  Since then, I've been hooked - great site!

Now about I love teriyaki - when my fiance and I moved to the city 2 years ago, we were looking for a good takeout place, local and affordable.  You know, for all those weekdays when you don't really feel like cooking, yet McD's just won't cut it.

Since we've found this place, we just can't get enough of it.  It's takeout 2 times a week, and we're always bringing guests here.  The sushi is terrific and their teriyaki is really Korean BBQ.  At $6 for a chicken box, definitely affordable sushi.

Our favorites:  
Chef special spicy roll
Ryan Roll
Negihama Roll
Spicy lobster
Poki salad
Chicken teriyaki
Beef shortrib teriyaki

They've just opened a fancier restaurant on King street called Nama (I think).  One of the greatest things about I love teriyaki too is the parking.
author: Emily W.
