description: I've been coming here for 6 years and I've never walked away unhappy. The sushi is always delicious and they have the best designer rolls around. I get the viper roll with cream cheese in it. Deep fried goodness. The teriyaki anything is also great although I generally stick to sushi. I'll keep on coming back.
author: Paul S.

description:
Coming from Vancouver that has sushi restaurants in every corner, I'm pretty judge mental with sushi joints here in the bay area. I just can't find a place that can compare to this little self owned sushi restaurant that I've been going to since 8Th grade back home. 
But this one is almost comparable. 
Living near the area before.. the bf and I had to try it (we are sushi lovers) and I must say that there sushi is pretty good i didn't try the teriyaki cause HELLO I'd rather eat sushi. 
I must recommend there spicy crab crunch roll because its just soooo good. The owner or the head chef or wtv gave me a hand roll to try, and I devoured it. HAHAHA
I even tried the tempura roll, dynamite roll, and some 7.95 roll i don't remember the name but it has avocado, tempura, real crab and some other stuff i dont remember but it was soo good. 

If your just starting out with sushi and dont know what to try.. try the kani roll instead of the california roll because kani roll is real crab not the fake crab they use for cali rolls.

The service was good not amazing but good.
author: Monique S.

description:
I Hate Teriyuki.  

The sushi was terrible, and I do mean TERRIBLE (though the pictures were fun to look at while we waited 40 minutes for our food to arrive).  Like so terrible that prior to this experience, I could easily have eaten spicy tuna every day for the rest. of. my. life.  But now?  Nope, will not go near it.  And it wasn't just the sushi - my friend ordered the spicy chicken (or something like that) and it was cold and rubbery.  And the servers were clearly overwhelmed though it wasn't even busy.  We had to get up and go to the counter when we needed a refill or an extra napkin.  

Thank goodness Live Sushi is in the Po'Hill now...maybe my taste for spicy tuna will come back eventually :'(
author: Dawn J.

description: I usually end up going to this place on any given Friday. The staff is very friendly. I don't know how to use chop sticks so one of the sushi chefs fixed a pair so I could use them. I love love love the Jason and Crunch rolls!!!
author: LaShea R.

description: Would seriously be a regular here if I lived close by.  The portions are pretty substantial and they use fresh ingredients here.  I like that there is a parking structure you can park in since the area surrounding is so busy. This place does classic sushi rolls well for pretty cheap!
author: Anna T.

description: This is a bit like fast food sushi. I went there because it was open for lunch on Saturday afternoon, and I probably won't go back. Service was decent, but sushi was just below average.
author: Emily H.

description:
Adam B. and I ate the hell out of this place one night.

I'm pretty sure we* ordered everything on the menu,
and it was all fantastic.

And easily the best amaebi heads I've ever had.

Mmm,
shrimp heads. . .

*"we"="I"
~oinkoink~
author: Don Q.

description:
Pros:
- cheap
- never busy
- cool lucky cat holding an Asahi bottle at the cash register

Cons:
- no "WOW!" factor, just your basic sushi joint
author: Susan L.

description:
The food is pretty good at this place and I like the prices, I just wish the service was better.

Every time I have gone, they basically just take my order, bring me my food, then ignore me until I can flag someone down for the bill. 

It's too bad, because I really like the food, especially the boxes, but I just don't feel like going there anymore. Better bet is to sit at the sushi bar.
author: Jimmy H.

description:
I'm ashamed to admit that I, too, shunned this place for well over a year because of, a) its "potrero center" location, and b) it's name!!! Taken in combination, those two criteria scream BAD SUSHI...to me, at least, and as it seems from previous reviews, to plenty of others, as well! I mean, c'mon now... when's the last time you went to a reputable dining establishment that had the word "LUV" in it's name?!?! They really ought to consider re-naming themselves, because they're worth it!!! They DESERVE a better, way less cheesy name!

I ordered an entire to-go sushi dinner for two for $20, which is not bad at all (it was three six-piece rolls, actually...I don't know if that technically would be considered a "dinner") It was damn good. I absolutely LOVED the Philadelphia roll (salmon, cucumber, cream cheese). The tempura spicy hamachi roll was also fab. 

Now that I've discovered it, I'll be coming a lot. I think a big part of it is I like the idea of eating sushi after I work out at 24 hr fitness...it makes for a relatively light dinner so I don't feel like I just un-did all my hard gym-ing!!!
author: Shannon R.

description:
Low quality sushi and sashimi. I had a bento lunch here. The portions were okay, except for the tiny slices of hamachi sashimi. The bento consisted of sides such as a substandard version of what I think was supposed to be Korean jap chae noodles, and a tasteless serving of Japanese pickled vegetables. 

The spicy tuna roll I shared with my lunch companion was okay and the best part of the meal. My lunch companion's tempura udon looked all right. He liked it fine. The tempura portion was dinky, however. 

I believe this restaurant is the Potrero Hill branch of Nama Sushi in SoMa. The food was pretty much on par with Nama - mediocre at best.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Ok, I know everyone has had bad experiences with service here...but I haven't had a problem yet. So I will go back and see what it's like to eat in there.

Gathering from the reviews...I think the best way to order the food here is to a) walk in, order, shop at Kragen or pay your Comcast Bill next door, then come back, pick up food, and leave  b) call in the order and give them a time you'll be there, pick up and leave.

I didn't feel like cooking, so I walked in the restaurant at 4:30 pm today, scanned the menu, and ordered a beef teriyaki and a Lion king roll to share with my mom. I saw alot of people ordering and taking it to go...so I think this is the key to eating the food here.

The food only took 10 minutes and they were very quick and friendly. 

Lion King roll is a california roll with baked salmon and their signature sauce on top. This was really good.  I took one piece and let my mom scarf down the rest. 5 stars

The beef teriyaki over rice was 4 stars. It is about 1 1/2 cups of grilled beef over steam white rice and just enough sauce. The side dishes are a small salad with creamy dressing and some cooked bean sprouts and cabbage.  It was good. 

Try take out and see what happens...
author: Charlene C.

description: This place doesn't look like much from the outside, but it's one of my favorite sushi places in the city. It's in a very unimpressive building, but don't let that deter you. We came during the week, and it wasn't very crowded. But, the service was prompt and efficient. We ordered a bunch of rolls, and they were all really tasty. The 49er roll was especially good. The place is reasonably priced, not like a lot of the sushi restaurants in the city that I find over-priced. We loved this place, and I can't wait to go back! YUM!
author: Christy M.

description: NOT pleased with the service or quality of food!! The waiter recommended the lion king and it taste like mayonnaise sauce and the rice started falling apart. It had a horrible after taste. I told the Manager and instead of him offering another dish. He said "no one put a GUN to to your head and forced you to order it, so you should pay for it!!" I told him I wasn't pleased with the dish. He said this is NOT a fast food restaurant and should pay for half. Of course, I'm not!! I guess that's what you get when you go to a hole in the wall sushi place. Never again!!!!
author: Tisha H.

description:
yay good cheap sushi! The cuts aren't skimpy, they have a creative roll list, including some baked ones and the prices are quite reasonable!

Much better than you fear it would be with that name.

I uh, have a serious addiction to that bean-sprout-salty-sesame-tasty pile they call "vegetable". what the bleep do they put in there? I've left there a couple times with a pint of that stuff, and I'm pretty sure I'm the only one who does that.... At least they don't bat an eye when I make my weird request 

And I've done it a few times over the years.
author: Ceren E.

description: Its a pretty cool little place.
author: Jae V.

description: Sushi was okay, a little sloppily rolled.  I went because it was conveniently located next to my gym.  I think that would be the only reason why I would go back.
author: C L.

description:
Maybe I'm a bit biased coz Suhn brother owned this joint. tee hee

Seriously, great sushi, affordable price,plenty of parking!

FYI:  he also open another restaurant by Pac Bell Park called Nama!
author: jubi l.

description:
When I am craving Japanese food and am in the area, I always come to this place. I don't even eat sushi!! I always order the gyoza (8 pieces of goodness). The vegetable tempura is delicious. The chicken teriyaki is the bomb.

It's a little pricey, but what Japanese place isn't. Getting in here can be a little tricky. You can park in the parking garage underneath Safeway and walk in thru the back door. Just follow the I Luv Teriyaki signs.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
This is my favorite place to eat sushi!!! Every bite is like an explosion in my mouth-  mmmmmmmm so good so good

there is always plenty of parking....   the service is great.... its never too crowded.... and the price is un beatable.  My friend Jaime and I go there and for the both of us its about 30 bucks!!  And we are both soooo full when we go- and extreamly satisfied. 

i LOVE this place.

they rock!
author: Jena D.

description:
Best sushi ever...best rolls...best sushi chefs...DO NOT get it confused with the other I luv teriyaki locations which are not good at all. The other ones are borderline gross ( the ones in folsom walnut creek and concord that is)

For some reason this one is amazing. And very personal and friendly. They also know there stuff.

I ask for a certain thing and they know exactly what I mean . The other locations look at me crazy and say " no one makes that....thats impossible"

Another thing is one of my friends is allergic to seaweed and this is the only sushi restaurant that gave him a " no problem" when he asked for the to make him a roll minus the seaweed.
They rolled it perfect too. 

very awesome
author: Jennie S.

description:
Yum, Yum, Yum. 

I'm a fan of I Love Teriyaki & Sushi. 

I've never actually had the teriyaki, but I would recommend the Agedashi Tofu and the Love Roll (basically a California Roll topped with baby baked scallops and a creamy spicy sauce). Great. I'm hungry now.
author: christina t.

description:
I wish i can afford to eat there every single day. I love their Salmon and Hamachi sashimi. It's sooo great specially during Lunch time. Because the sashimi is so good but is $$$ for me that i have save $ just to eat there every Friday. 
I always order the Sashimi combination or dinner set for lunch. If i can afford it, i will go there every day.  :') .........
author: Tea Z.

description: I had the chicken teriyaki.  It was pretty good. The food came quick. It was a lot of food.
author: Sandy P.

description:
I just started working in the area (SOMA/Protero Hill) and I have been in search of places to eat. Coming from the Financial District, it's been hard to adjust to the lack of dining options around here.

I found I love Teriyaki & Sushi online and decided to try it out. I played it safe with beef teriyaki. It was AWESOME. The best beef teriyaki I have ever had. The beef was thin sliced and grilled. I could tell it was marinated in something delicious and then a light teriyaki sauce was drizzled over it. Unlike most Japanese restaurants, there were no fatty pieces and the portion size was really good. 

The service was good and I got my food quickly. I was in and out in about 40 minutes. The food is a bit pricey but not unreasonable. I have a feeling it's all worth it.

I will definitely be going back and after watching them prepare the sushi, I will be trying that next time as well!
author: Krystal S.

description:
Pleasant Surprise...they keep Uni (sea urchin) fresh

I walked in, expecting food to be NOT good at all...i was wrong.  excellent rolls...big lunch boxes (beef, spicy pork, chicken & spicy chicken), wide selections  for great price...esp for SF area.

Great Value for combo items...heck McD combo meal cost more in SF...
plus, parking is not a problem.

They have fresh Uni...those who know sushi...there only two way to keep Uni fresh...sell them a lot or throw out and order new...you can do the math.  this says lot of about quality & freshness of fish...

if not expecting 5 stars, you won't be disappointed with their food.  
time to eat!!
author: B K.

description:
Here are three very easy general rules to figure out whether you're going to a mediocre Japanese restaurant catering to white people.

1) Does the ricer dinner-set include miso soup?

2) If so, does the miso soup come with your main entre, as opposed to the beginning?

3) Are Bento boxes available only during lunch, and not dinner?

If all three of these answers aren't "yes", then chances are you don't need to bother. This restaurant falls under the "keep away" category. FYI, bento box is Japanese for lunch box. Yes, you think the nifty partitioned plastic tray looks exotic, but it's a ridiculous gimmick that only Japanese-food noobs fall for. Who wants a lunch box for dinner? I had neither the teriyaki nor the sushi, but I don't need either to figure out this place isn't worth it. Reasons:

1) Gyoza. Japanese people almost never deep fry it--they pan fry the bottom and let water boil the top. Fail. Tastes like frozen microwavable pork pot stickers you can buy at any market.

2) Tempura. I didn't eat it, but just looking at it I could tell it wasn't right. It's supposed to be very light in taste and texture, this was much darker.

3) Sesame seed fried chicken. I ordered this, and it was actually pretty decent. But I've never even heard of such a dish (was expecting karaage but got this instead).

4) Sushi. Don't bother with sushi restaurants that have a giant selection of non-sushi entres. If it's a good sushi restaurant, then they'd be spending all their time/money getting quality neta (fish), and skilled itamae-sans to make them. (this rule also generally applies to ramen)

The only redeeming quality is that the price isn't too bad, and the food was ok. But it's really not hard to find (or make) better Japanese food than this.
author: Ak S.

description: Not the best,not the worst. Rice was kinda undercooked. Tempura tasted similar to like freezer section tempura- in fact it was so bad I could only eat 3/6 without getting totally grossed out. Service was ok.
author: John S.

description: I love I love teriyaki and sushi.  It's very hard to find a good sushi house and this has to be one of the best. The food is affordable and I'm not the kind of person to go back to a sushi house religiously but I do crave this place.  I've been to high and low end sushi houses and there is just something about this place that has me coming back.  Maybe it's because it's affordable or may be it's because the fish is fresh and the rolls are tasty.  The entrée items are equally delicious.  You just can't go wrong in this place.  It's not the best atmosphere but  since it's in a shopping center there is always free parking.
author: Eleanor L.

description: This place is awesome. So unassuming in its little strip mall venue too. Don't let that fool you. The short rib teriyaki box is amazing. It's so good, I haven't even gotten to the sushi yet.
author: Chris R.

description:
You know you are in a great place when you need a gas-station type key for the bathroom that is shared with your restaurant and...the underground parking lot?  I suppose it is in a strip mall location, but this was almost as disorienting as the bathroom at Etiquette.

Now, the reason that I had to use the restroom was because I had ordered the large sake to share with Erin R.  I don't remember the price exactly, but it wasn't so expensive that I expected a full teapot of warm sake.  Not a cute little teapot either.  This thing dwarfed the sake cups that came with it.  It turned my Wednesday night around.

The food is pretty good for the janky location, and cheaper than sister restaurant Nama.  Now that I am in know, I enter through the underground parking lot, bathroom exit/entrance so that I don't have to walk around to Portrero St. after parking.  I embrace seediness when decent food and teapots of sake accompany it.
author: Brooke G.

description: Have to drop my 5 star review on this place after our last visit. Jay who I think still owns the place has let things slip here. I don't know if he still owns the place because I haven't seen him the last 5 times I've been in there. The place has become dirty and the quality of the food has gone down several pegs. Our server the other night couldn't get anything right and even forgot a few things that we ordered but they were on the bill. I used to love this place but after the other night it's just not the same.
author: Baron S.

description: I am a snob when it comes to my sake sashimi.    Take out, or dine in;  I eat here...  often.  I  have now fallen in love with their spicy crunch roll.  Come here when you want to enjoy good sushi.  If you want to entertain,  go to Blowfish.
author: Michelle C.

description: They have a great deal on the bento boxes, almost the cheapiest I've seen although I hear that Japantown has even cheaper bento boxes (the fish or meat might be questionable though). I've also had the rolls and they're large and delicious and will stuff you up like nobody's business. It's also hidden under the Potrero Mall so finding it is kind of an adventure.
author: Gina R.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday lunch. The sushi, salad, tempura and miso was all good. They even brought my friend some mochi with a candle in it for her birthday. I asked for green tea but received regular tea, but that's all good with me. I'm sure we'll be back for lunch.
author: Kellie P.

description: This place is so great - cheap, awesome food and huge portions! I usually come here just for the teriyaki because it's some of the best, especially the spicy pork teriyaki. However, I finally adventured into their sushi rolls after countless times of flipping through their sushi photo rolodex and have to say it really tastes as good as it looks in the pics - delish! I'm only giving it 4-stars because the wait staff is a little slow.
author: Donna A.

description: I have gone to this location for several years, and my oldest daughter loves it.. She is only 10 and she is all over the sushi. I just went last night for her B-day and i got her some sushi. She really loves it and the prices are not bad at all.
author: Dalia C.

description: Good Food. Reasonable prices. Don't waste your time trying to get a discount from this place ; ). When it is busy, it is hard to get a table and the waiters/waitresses will ignore you. Try going at offpeak hours.
author: Dao C.

description: The restaurant was empty around 5PM. I took a togo menu and went to exercise, planning to call them with an order 15 minutes before I would be  by to pick it up. When I called, they said it'd be done in 10. Lo and behold, I get there and they haven't even put the order in, they had been serving a party of 6 and forgot about my order. They apologized, but I was late and that stresses me out, disadvantageous to the preceding workout. At least the chicken teriyaki lasted me for two days for a low price of $7 and I could stirfry it with some veggies. The iceberg lettuce with the mayo dressing doesn't cut it for me.
author: Kim G.

description: I can't belive I haven't reviewed this place yet because this is one of my favorite sushi places to go!  I love their salmon/chicken teriyaki boxes which includes noodles, veggies, rice, and of course the teriyaki goodness! Their salmon sashimi box is also excellent! SOOOO YUMMY! They also have a good assortment of sushi like their spicy tuna roll, poki roll, and veggie nigiri.  Dammit, I love everything they have to offer. Great oysters, too.  I'm getting hungry.  I love coming here because it's affordable and the quality is amazing.  This place never fails me because I am always satisfied. The only reason why I gave it 4 out of 5 is because the waitresses could be a little friendlier. Other than that--I love it!
author: Mel P.

description: Great service at the bar. Wonderful prices. Friendly sushi chefs. Fresh fish. Open late night on weekdays. Fast. Always a plus when it's late, your tired, and you don't want to cook. Good neighborhood. Love the spicy tuna roll. SPICY! Just the way I like it. It's worth checking out!
author: monika l.

description: Great neighborhood joint for sushi. Not the most 'hip' looking spot but never fails to have great sushi. I personally go there for the avocado rolls as they only use perfectly ripe avocados!
author: rukshan b.

description: This is my secret sushi place. Secret because from the outside, you can't tell how awesome the sushi is inside. The hamachi and salmon sashimi are smooth like butter and there is a wide selection of sushi rolls. I like coming here during the week and on weekends when I'm craving good, cheap, sushi without a wait. Oh yeah, and since it's part of a strip mall - plenty of parking.
author: Evelyn G.

description:
i wouldnt really call this a japanese resturant.  yeah they make sushi and they have a sashimi bar, but they also have korean food and use korean garnishes.  

the food was basic japaese food with korean twists.  we had stir fryed noodles... which was good but my mama could make that too.  my friend got pork "teriyaki" which was bascially korean spicy pork barbeque... both dishes came with korean garnishes.  and also clean noodles. it's jahp che fool!! 

i think there are so many japanese places in the city that you have to really work work for the wow factor... this place just lacks that element.  the prices are average i guess... i think the reason why so many asian people open japanese places is because they can peg prices that people are still willing to shell out. 


for me, the service was attenttive.  she even refilled my tea without me asking.
author: Doug ..

description: I started coming to this place in 2005 and ive been hooked ever since! Their service is great! You will always be greeted as soon as you come in the door. You never have to worry about your food tasting different everytime you come like at others places I've been to. I always get a teriyaki chicken box, gyozas! The sushi varies on how i feel that day but they never fail me! Also their prices are very affordable and the food is plentiful!
author: Cindy D.

description: I usually go here when I'm at my sisters' house and we dont feel like driving too far (like all the way to the Sunset) but it is never a disappointement. It's cheap and the portions are decent. All the dishes I have tried have been pretty good. We usually get a Love Roll, any other rolls we feel like trying, and bento boxes. The only downside is that you don't get your own pot of tea, so you always have to ask and wait, unless you specifically ask for your own pot.
author: Katrina C.

description:
Ate here 12/14 as I was dying of hunger. I ordered the Lion King Roll and it wasn't what I thought it would be. The pieces were smaller that I had seen before. I don't know if I can compare it to Sushi House in Alameda. That one over there looks professional and complete. 

I thought the roll was ok and the wasabi wasn't pure, but that was fine. I don't know if I'd come back here. The price was about the same as Sushi House.
author: Jen C.

description: I wrote this place off for so long because it was in a shopping center and has a stupid name, but it became a regular weekly place for me and a few friends. Order a whole lot of sushi, too much sake and have a great time!
author: Ian M.

description: Good place for lunch since I work 2 blocks away. Wait is long so call in if you want something to go. Good variety of items on their menu.
author: Jacinta H.

description:
I work in the Potrero Hill area and "LUV" is one of my favorite lunch spots. From the dodgey location and hokey signage you would think this place is to be avoided if you didn't want to get food poisoning. However, my Asian co-workers, who have frequented this place for a long time before I cam e along, are not wrong about this place. I don't know much about the owners but I get the feeling that this place is family run and there seems to be a lot of dedication about their business and warmth from all of those who work here. The mood is jovial and quick during the lunch rush. Food wise, I only order rolls of which this place has many variations including some rather creative or  "experimental" ones that have names like "Chris's Roll" or "Jake's Roll". I assume that these are rolls named after employees who created them but who knows. All I know is that for a non-sashimi sushi eater, this place is perfect. Also, the rolls are big and come in many pieces. Two rolls with a small salad is MORE than enough for lunch, in fact I couldn't even finish mine. The box lunches that my co-workers order also look very good and plentiful.

This place is surprisingly great, at least for lunch, and would eat here even if I didn't work around the block.
author: Alotta F.

description:
This is the best sushi place in town, and it won't put that much of a dent in your wallet  Their creations are as varied, fresh and delicious, as they are colorful.  I've never had a better rainbow roll, even though I've paid more for others.   Also recommended are their warm  "Love roll", which is a sushi topped with fresh scallops and a seafood newberg sauce, their "Craig's roll", which is wrapped around tempura and topped with three colors (black, green and orange) of caviar, and their croquettes, which are crisp and light.  

We've been going there regularly for the past few months.  It's tucked away in the Potrero Shopping Center with lots of parking.  If you're looking for high end Japanese decor, this is probably not it.  If you're looking for simply great sushi at a reasonable price this is the place to go.
author: Michael W.

description:
they have tons of choices on their menu, but i feel that their rolls are kinda pricey because they are so tiny!!!
i ordered 20 dollars of food (for myself only) and was still hungry!

they give decent cuts for their nigiri, but i ordered a 12$ roll that only had two slivers of avocado and fish.  disappointing.  after i was done eating, i had to turn to my faithful instant top raman.
author: H. L.

description: The sushi here is good.  I've ordered their Rainbow Roll and Seaweed Salad.  The place is small and cozy and the service was quick and friendly.  Nothing really stood out about this place other than its convenience during lunch.
author: R B.

description: Super cheap and good bento boxes. I dig the pork teriyaki, yum! Also, they have interesting sushi rolls to choose from, I like to try the weird ones, so this is a good lunch spot for me. It gets pretty packed at noon, so go before or after.
author: Colleen B.

description: love the sushi rolls and sashimi. :) especilaly love the not too busy atmosphere. Freash and reasonable priced sashimi. Great place for dinner after a long day at work and a night where you don't feel like cooking but want something healthy and fresh. =)
author: Ervinna L.

description: Good spicy rolls and fish was pretty fresh. I think the staff handling orders can get frazzled. Spicy tuna was really hot after 2nd piece. Also had a spicy roll with tempura topped with salmon. Had a roll with salmon topped with tuna. Good stuff.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Ordered a Teriyaki chicken and combination sushi. Sushi is relatively fresh. Teriyaki chicken is dry. Price is a little on the high side for what you get. Looks like the owner or people running the place are Koreans. 
Only 2 stars cause they are cleaning the place during peak lunch time. So the place smells like a bath room.
author: root r.

description:
What can I say about this place. Well, to put it plainly, the food is what you're coming here for. It is truly amazing for the price. The sushi is fresh, tender and simply delicious. One of the great achievements of this restaurant is their ability to offer such unique dishes (you'll see once you've scoured the menu for yourself). 

The restaurant itself is nothing special and the service is not that great (at least in my own experience. It seems the table next to us was getting great service). We ordered a lot of food for four people, but they forgot to bring us two of our bento boxes. It wasn't a big deal though, as they apolgized and gave us a free plate of chicken teriyaki which was EXCELLENT :)

All in all, as I said in the beginning, the quality of food and the price is what you're coming here for. First class sushi at a great price easily exceeds my little quibbles over under par service and environment!
author: Chris W.

description: this place is great...don't feel like cooking, which is usual, so I'll run down here and get some teriyaki to go. I'll usually get the chicken and tempura combo, but I do have a soft spot for sesame chicken and beef. When I've eaten in, service was decent, no complaints...I felt like a stupid american for having to ask for forks though. I'm pretty sure they've raised their prices a bit, but I still think it's worth it
author: Marie W.

description: Talk about food comatose.  This bento box came with either 3 big california rolls or 3 pieces of sushi then you still have your soup and salad the i don't know how many pieces of tempura they give you with the two shrimps and they have rice, noodles and veggies.  I didn't even dent the box.  Its worth going here especially if you are hungry.
author: May A.

description: Rolls galore at this place!  Neighborhood sushi places are great and all but this is one place I crave and am willing to make the drive just to eat there. The waitstaff is friendly, the sushi chefs always greet you, and the rolls are fantastic. Definitely diggin the picture book of rolls so you know exactly what you're getting. The tuna poke appetizer is filled with fish so that is a great starter. Any of the rolls are divine!
author: Josephine H.

description: Good, cheap sushi. This is my local sushi place for mid-week sushi rolls in the 'hood (near potrero hill). There is always parking, if you need it, nearby. And it is great for fast food at a low price. Decor is non-existent so don't look up from your maki and seaweed salad : )
author: Alison P.

description: I went here for lunch today, but due to the fact that it's located in a strip mall (parking garage) and has a fast foodish place feel to it, I didn't try the sushi. I was too scared. I had the chicken teriyaki (kinda hard to go wrong there) and some gyoza- both were alright. Not great, not horrible. Kinda what I expected.
author: Ashly M.

description: I work right nearby, so I have eaten here plenty of times. The owner is really friendly and a cool guy. I normally get chicken teriyaki or udon noodle soup, both very good! The Poki salad is really good, too, but pricey. The sushi is fresh and the service is good.
author: Freckles H.

description: A little too pricey for the rolls considering the ambience. There was some sort of bleachy smell going on. The sashimi we ordered didn't taste very fresh. Food was mediocre at best. Friendly service at least.
author: Natalie S.

description: Cheap bento boxes, check! And wide selection of sushi rolls and sashimi, check!  The tables are always clean, everything is fresh and the service is fast and efficient.  Nice place to actually talk and listen to whomever you're with.
author: brenda b.

description: i love "I Luv"! one of the best sushi spots in the city i swear. employess are always nice. parking is great. wish was open everyday.
author: vicki g.

description: Goodfood, nice place Great Bento boxes!! you get for the deluxe box you get the ontrea, sushi, ans miso soup and tempura great for a quick fix
author: Martin G.

description: Had some awesome sushi here last night.  They had all kinds of sushi that I haven't seen at other places including the Super California Roll which put a load of extra avocado goodness in my mouth.  The warm sake we ordered was not so great tho.  Might have to try requesting a specific kind.  The service was great and everyone was really nice.
author: Michael B.

description: Came here during lunch. Wasn't greeted, seated ourselves. Had to go up to the bar to ask the waitress if we could order. Waited some more for her to finally get to our table. She gave us a half-ass apology for the wait and took our order. We saw a bunch of people who came in before us LEAVE before we even got our food. Poor, slow service, understaffed, average food. Won't come here again.
author: Christine Y.

description: I've been to this place a few times for lunch and thought the food was OK.  I've had their sushi rolls and thought they were pretty good.  I didn't care too much for their udons though.  The lunch Teriyaki Boxes were great and the price was reasonable!
author: JenJen W.

description: Used to work in the same complex as this place. Very nice place to get food during my lunch break. The sushi is decent, but the bentos and other food is very good. You can see the food be made in front of you so thats pretty cool, and everything else is pretty good. Though the curry could be a lot better if they didn't use the same meat for teriyaki for their curry dishes.
author: Danny K.

description: The best sushi place i have ever ate. Great service fresh fish
author: tom g.

description: The sushi is good, especially their specialty sushi.  The beef and chicken  teriyaki dishes are also good, and well priced for the amount of good you receive.  I suggest the beef short rip...its delicious.  The atmosphere sucks and the service can be a bit slow, but its still a good place to get a meal.
author: Franz L.

description: one word: COCKROACHES. Sushi isn't bad. I would give it a 7.5 out of 10. Pricing is fair. Service is excellent. Everything was great one day, today, until I went to get my lunch order. After picking up my food to go, a cockroach ran through the kitchen. gross. I saw two in the 15 mins I was there. tummies beware
author: Katrina B.

description:
I love the teriyaki, especially the spicy pork and the chicken one. Buuut one time (I come to this place pretty often) I was eating.... and... there was a tiny piece of ROCK in my food. I was eating and there was something hard inside my mouth. I spit it out and it's this gray thing. I poked at it with my chopstick and it doesn't break so I know it's a burnt piece of meat. Of course I'd go back again, but I hope I don't find another piece of rock in my food. 

And I don't really like the fact that half the people are cleaning the kitchen while people are still cooking. :/
author: Anita T.

description: they are a little pricey and i ordered the Spicy Tuna Rolla dn Rock and Roll and it came out to $12! those rolls themselves are usually like $3or$4 each so its alil pricey and they dont even put enough meat in em!
author: Pierre L.

description: OK... I don't want to spoil it for anyone since I do encourage others to try their own tastes when it comes to sushi, but please try your lovers roll.  I have to order it every time we go! I think that they have a great menu and a very chelaxed atmosphere.  I am never disappointed when I go.
author: M D.

description: Im not much of a sushi fan but I do enjoy there 'box lunches'. The spicy chicken teriyaki box is mmmmm. They also serve unfiltered sake in sm/md/lg jars. Their potstickers are also good. Thats about all I know about this place. Friends and family all enjoyed what they had. Sometimes the service is laggy, but thats only when you're busy.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
I have never been a fan of sushi, so I cannot comment on their sushi, however, many of my friends say it is just average.

However, I do enjoy their teriyaki plates (box's as they like to call it). I have tried pretty much all of them, but I always suggest the chicken or spicy pork teriyaki. 

The staff is very friendly. Every time I show up, I am always greeted by everyone. Parking is very easy considering there is street parking and a parking garage. Their prices are also very reasonable.
author: Giacomo R.

description:
I luv this place!

I would have to since I go here every week. Without fail. If I'm gonna be out of town on my Sushi day (gasp!) we go on a different night.

Go, sit at the bar, order the Craig roll, drink too much sake, and have a good time!
author: Caitlin V.

description:
Really great! Lots of space, great people, great prices. AWESOME helpings of meat on your plate, they always have the game on, and don't care if my kid is throwing a tantrum (but i do). They always smile when i come in, and wave. 
I give it four stars, just because you sometimes have to wait too long for the waitress to come, or come back again
author: Caitlin S.

description: great grilled meats, \ more of a bbq joint, the sushi is ok, the korean short ribs and the chicken are my favs
author: Seiken N.

description: cheap and tasty teriyaki... however, I had to take off a star because I now have heartburn (though this could be due to the rate at which I shoveled food into my mouth).  I'd still probably go back.
author: Nat K.

description: Went on a friend's recommendation and let's just say I'll be taking her recommendations with a grain of salt from now on. My personal experience was not so great. When it comes to restaurants, I'm huge on cleanliness. This place just didn't give me a clean feel. Maybe it was because it was fairly empty on a Saturday night or gross bathrooms which require you to use a dirty looking key to get in. Honestly, I felt that touching the key defeated the purpose of washing my hands before I eat. Or maybe it was the shady looking couple that smelled of weed sitting near us. Or maybe even the random bit of rice, origin unknown (none of the tables near us were eating yet), that fell on my sweater right when I sat down. Setting aside, the American-style sushi was only okay, nothing to write home about and they used a good amount of rice and less fish. In terms of price, it was very slightly less than normal though not slight enough to balance out the yucky feel the place gave me. On a positive note, the waitress was very friendly and sweet, and the picture album of the rolls is a nice touch. Still, I'd rather go to Sushi Zen any day! Won't be going back.
author: Alexis C.

description: I've been going to this place for years, and have to give it all five stars.  Honestly, it's not my absolute favorite sushi bar in town but it's the one that I'll frequent the most.  The reason:  The price is excellent for the wonderful quality of food and friendly staff.  They are a perfect spot for dinner or lunch, and even perfect for an hour lunch break at work.  I started going here because you can get a killer Bento Box with teriyaki chicken, edamame, salad, clear noodles, veggies, and rice for cheap that fills you up.  Oh yeah, in about 3 minutes as well.  Then I slowly started expanding to get sushi and maki.  Boy was I impressed.  They always have awesome sushi chefs that I love to sit at the bar and chat with while watching the masters at work.  My favorite roll is the Spicy Crab Crunch roll, or the "Chris Roll" which is the above mentioned with Salmon and Avocado on it as well.  The salmon is EXCELLENT, rich and buttery and a staple for nigiri when going here.  I also love their spicy tuna roll, ryan roll, april roll, and the dream gina roll just to name a few.  There are honestly not too many rolls I haven't tried here as I try to go at least once a week.  Once they got three beers on draft, it's hard to pull me away from the counter. J  You have to try this place, and try the Chris Roll.  If you have to go to the Hell they call Comcast anyway, this place will even out your day and put a smile back on your face...
author: Chris C.

description: The place is hard to spot but they draw a pretty decent crowd for dinner. I was here once for lunch and it was also busy. The food was very good, the sushi fresh-we had Hamachi sashimi,  the rolls very tasty especially the special spicy rolls-we ordered spicy scallop, spider roll, spicy tuna roll, spicy fried tuna roll, and some others, even the dressing for the salad in the bento box was good!  They have a lot of unique rolls that I havent seen at other sushi restaurants. The service is excellent and staff are very friendly there.
author: Ravenous T.

description: It's solid.  I have a shop across the street and have eaten here about a million times.  The sushi is good, the noodle dishes are good, I don't dig the curry.
author: Geoff L.

description: I love the sake nigiri here--I think it's the best that I've had anywhere--and I've tried a lot of places. I had hamachi there the other night that was like butter, mmmmm. Sometimes the service is a little slow, but always friendly. So I just don't go if I'm in a rush.
author: Carrie S.
